p: The murine B16 melanoma cells were purchased from the Type Culture Collection of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (Shanghai, China, No. TCM2) and were cultured in high glucose Dulbecco's modified eagle medium (HG-DMEM, Gibco) supplemented with 10% FBS (BI, Biological Industries), 100 μg•mL −1 streptomycin, and 100 U•mL −1 penicillin (Gibco, Cat. No. 15140-122). The cells were maintained in a humidified incubator with 5% CO2 at 37°C, and they were subcultured every 2 days to maintain logarithmic growth.
